abstract: Bank of America on Monday reported a 44 percent drop in second-quarter earnings as real-estate-related losses overwhelmed record revenue across its businesses. The results weren’t as bad as many on Wall Street had feared.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America on Monday reported a 44 percent drop in second-quarter earnings as real-estate-related losses overwhelmed record revenue across its businesses. The results weren’t as bad as many on Wall Street had feared.

headline.main: BofA’s Profits Fall, But Beat Expectations
